unnormalised: Hey guys, I'm looking to buy a flat in Mumbai, preferably near Andheri station. I've been checking out different websites, but the address formats are all over the place! Some say "Flat no. 101, Building A, XYZ Apartments, Andheri (W)", while others write it as "A/101, XYZ Apartments, Andheri West". It's kinda confusing, yaar!
normalised: Hey guys, I'm looking to buy a flat in Mumbai, preferably near Andheri station. I've been checking out different websites, but the address formats are all over the place! Some say "Flat number one hundred and one, Building A, X-Y-Z Apartments, Andheri West", while others write it as "A slash one hundred and one, X-Y-Z Apartments, Andheri West". It's kinda confusing, yaar!

unnormalised: Also, the property listings sometimes have incomplete addresses. Like, they'll only mention "Near Infinity Mall, Andheri" without the full address. Is that normal? I'm worried about getting lost when I go for site visits. Plus, what's the deal with postal codes? Do I really need to know the 400053 or whatever for every place?
normalised: Also, the property listings sometimes have incomplete addresses. Like, they'll only mention "Near Infinity Mall, Andheri" without the full address. Is that normal? I'm worried about getting lost when I go for site visits. Plus, what's the deal with postal codes? Do I really need to know the four hundred thousand and fifty three or whatever for every place?

unnormalised: I saw one ad listing the address as "Gala No. 5, Ground Floor, Ambani Estate, Juhu". Is "Gala" the same as "Flat" in this context? The price seems too good to be true, so I'm a bit skeptical. My friend suggested checking out properties in "Lokhandwala Complex, Andheri (E)", but the rent there is usually higher than the Rs. 30,000 budget I have.
normalised: I saw one ad listing the address as "Gala Number five, Ground Floor, Ambani Estate, Juhu". Is "Gala" the same as "Flat" in this context? The price seems too good to be true, so I'm a bit skeptical. My friend suggested checking out properties in "Lokhandwala Complex, Andheri East", but the rent there is usually higher than the rupee thirty thousand budget I have.

unnormalised: Basically, I'm just overwhelmed by all the variations in how addresses are written here in Mumbai. Any tips on how to decipher these real estate listings and find a decent place without getting scammed? Any help would be appreciated! Thanks in advance!
normalised: Basically, I'm just overwhelmed by all the variations in how addresses are written here in Mumbai. Any tips on how to decipher these real estate listings and find a decent place without getting scammed? Any help would be appreciated! Thanks in advance!
